message.body: That awkward moment when you are more radical than the lgbt movement.
As opposed to civil unions? What does that mean?
Chosen families, that sort of thing. Nonmonogamy, etc.
Ahh. Interesting. I obviously get nonmonogamy but what do you mean by chosen families and what would the alternatives be?
Yes please. Also my rude awakening to the lack of internal memory in feminism.
Want to go to dinner at 5:45? :)
I think i am going to go at five or five fifteen. Sorry!

I kind of want to talk about the development of non-monosexual identities (not homosexual or heterosexual...so not just bisexual but pansexual or queer as a vague term or refusal to use a label) and how those came to be and how they have been used and understood...if it has enough to do with sex... (If it doesn't I can't use it)
